intro: Deinbollia macroura, commonly known as the long-stalked sida, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, which are typically borne on long pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, dry seeds. Deinbollia macroura is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
